subject: Education
title: The One Laptop Per Child Experiment
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The One Laptop Per Child Experiment.

hook.text: Give every child in the developing world a laptop and education will transform. That was the theory.

buildup.text: Nicholas Negroponte launched OLPC in 2005 with a bold $100 laptop for every child.

discovery.text: The project distributed millions of devices to children in dozens of developing countries.

twist.text: Most studies found no significant improvement in math or readingâ€”devices alone don't teach.

climax.text: The lesson: technology without teacher training, curriculum, and support changes nothing.

punchline.text: A computer without a teacher is just an expensive toy.

quiz.question: What was the main lesson from the One Laptop Per Child program?
options: Technology without teacher training and curriculum support doesn't improve learning
Laptops are too expensive for developing countries
